column3: @fanquake I had assumed the Windows signed sigs needed the private code signing key. I guess that's not the case? I'll take a look at the docs again.

> @fanquake I had assumed the Windows signed sigs needed the private code signing key. I guess that's not the case? I'll take a look at the docs again.\n\nNo, that's not the case, the signing stage is really "attach  existing signature to known output" not so much "sign"
It should be in the first name alphabetic order.
Ahh somehow didn't spot that. Fixed now. Woo hoo straight to the top of the list (if accepted that is)!
